intro: Leucosyris mattturneri, commonly known as the Mattturner's leucosyris, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow ray florets surrounded by tubular disc florets, typical of the family. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Leucosyris mattturneri is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
